meanings.definition: To become brown or darken in color.
meanings.sent1: The leaves were imbrowning in the autumn sun.
meanings.sent2: The bread was imbrowning in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The snowman was imbrowning under the hot sun, turning into a puddle.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph was imbrowning with age, capturing memories in sepia tones.
meanings.sent5: The once green fields were imbrowning slowly as summer faded into fall.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become brown or darken in color.
meanings.sent1: She was imbrowning the meat on the grill for the barbecue.
meanings.sent2: The artist was imbrowning the canvas with rich earthy tones.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally imbrowned the sugar, giving the dessert a caramel flavor.
meanings.sent4: The sun was imbrowning the skin of beachgoers, leaving them with a tan.
meanings.sent5: The fire was imbrowning the edges of the paper, creating a rustic effect.
